page.title: 09Extra curricular activities
page.content: Extra curricular activities play a big part in the life of Coedylan Comprehensive School.Much is done for charity.During 1985 Â£200 was collected for the Ethiopia Famine Fund.In 1984 the lower school pupils held a harvest festival for the old age pensioners,bringing in a variety of food which was then distributed to the elderly of the district.Over a period of 3 years lower school children also raised Â£950 to help pay for the training of guide dogs for the blind. A dance was held for a young girl to receive treatment for leukaemia.Boys regularly maintain the memorial and graves of unnamed miners who lost their lives in the disaster at the Albion Colliery whose reclaimed site the school was built on.
